pullRequest.body:
We show that re and im are uniformly continuous and then use this to show that re/im parts of a uniform limit converge uniformly.

---

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message

Deletions:

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10343589337/job/28627902065)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10343589337/job/28627902169)

```suggestion
lemma uniformContinous_re : UniformContinuous re :=
  reCLM.uniformContinuous
```
same below

```suggestion
protected lemma TendstoUniformlyOn.re {f : Î¹ â†’ Î± â†’ â„‚} {p : Filter Î¹} {g : Î± â†’ â„‚} {K : Set Î±}
    (hf : TendstoUniformlyOn f g p K) : TendstoUniformlyOn (fun n x => (f n x).re)
```
same below
Also, please add a version for `TendstoUniformly`.

```suggestion
lemma uniformContinous_re : UniformContinuous re :=
```
same below

IMHO, it's easier to read the code if related parts are on the same line.
```suggestion
    (hf : TendstoUniformlyOn f g p K) :
    TendstoUniformlyOn (fun n x => (f n x).re) (fun y => (g y).re) p K := by
```
`f` can be an implicit argument here and below.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Analysis/Complex/ReImTopology): Uniform continuity of re im
